results.title: Pope Francis Ends Landmark Meeting by Calling for ‘All-Out Battle’ to Fight Sexual Abuse
results.abstract: Francis argued that more was required than legal processes and “disciplinary measures” from the Roman Catholic Church. But his speech offered no policy remedies.
results.byline: By JASON HOROWITZ and ELIZABETH DIAS

results.title: On Foreign Trips, Pence Steps Out of Trump’s Shadow but Always Stays on Message
results.abstract: Vice President Mike Pence is commonly seen around Washington as a mute helpmate to a bombastic president. On foreign soil, he has toyed with the idea of branching out — just not too far.

results.title: Judge Dismisses Charges in Boy’s Decapitation on 170-Foot-Tall Water Slide
results.abstract: A 10-year-old boy died on a waterslide at a Kansas waterpark in 2016. A judge ruled that prosecutors engaged in “grand jury abuse” and dismissed charges against those who designed it.

multimedia.caption: Jeffrey W. Henry at the Verrückt waterslide that he helped design for a Kansas water park. Criminal charges brought against him and others in connection with a fatal accident on the slide were dismissed on Friday.
multimedia.copyright: Charlie Riedel/Associated Press

results.title: Judge Dismisses Charges in Boy’s Decapitation on 170-Foot-Tall Water Slide

results.title: What You Really Want to Know About the Candidates for Chicago Mayor
results.abstract: Nine of the leading contenders in Chicago's wide-open mayoral election on Tuesday give nutshell answers to some essential and not-so-essential questions.
results.byline: By JULIE BOSMAN and ALYSSA SCHUKAR

results.title: Hate Crime Hoaxes Are Rare, but Can Be ‘Devastating’
results.abstract: In the aftermath of Jussie Smollett’s arrest, one lawmaker has promised to draft a bill increasing the penalty for filing false reports.

results.title: He Knows Broadway, Year by Year. Offstage, 2018 Was a Personal Worst.
results.abstract: Scott Siegel, who stages the “Broadway by the Year” series at Town Hall, was hurt in a bicycle accident last year. But the show must go on.

results.title: Breaking Up With One Show to Take Another to Broadway
results.abstract: The actors and friends Damon Daunno and Amber Gray shared the stage in both “Oklahoma!” and “Hadestown.” For the big move, something had to give.

results.title: DNA Gets a New — and Bigger — Genetic Alphabet
results.abstract: DNA is spelled out with four letters, or bases. Researchers have now built a system with eight. It may hold clues to the potential for life elsewhere in the universe and could also expand our capacity to store digital data on Earth
